headline.main: Judge Keeps Most of Gag Order in Former W.Va. Coal Exec Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Keeps Most of Gag Order in Former W.Va. Coal Exec Case

docs.lead_paragraph: A judge is upholding most of a gag order in a criminal case against ex-Massey Energy CEO Don Blankenship, who was in charge of the Upper Big Branch mine when it exploded and killed 29 men.
docs.snippet: A judge is upholding most of a gag order in a criminal case against ex-Massey Energy CEO Don Blankenship, who was in charge of the Upper Big Branch mine when it exploded and killed 29 men....

headline.main: Attendants Say They Were Unfairly Fired for Refusing to Fly
headline.print_headline: Attendants Say They Were Unfairly Fired for Refusing to Fly

docs.lead_paragraph: Thirteen flight attendants filed a federal complaint Wednesday against United Airlines saying they were fired for refusing to fly from San Francisco to Hong Kong on a plane with the words "BYE BYE" and a pair of faces scrawled on it, their attorneys said Wednesday.

headline.main: Panorama Photos Show the Decisive Minute

docs.lead_paragraph: Chuy Benitez makes sweeping panoramas of everyday scenes, turning a moment into a minute.
docs.snippet: Chuy Benitez makes sweeping panoramas of everyday scenes, turning a moment into a minute....

headline.main: Chitresh Das, Indian Classical Dancer, Dies at 70
headline.print_headline: Chitresh Das, Indian Classical Dancer, Dies at 70

docs.lead_paragraph: Chitresh Das, a renowned practitioner and teacher of the kathak form of Indian classical dance, has died. He was 70.
docs.snippet: Chitresh Das, a renowned practitioner and teacher of the kathak form of Indian classical dance, has died. He was 70....

headline.main: Teenager Pleads Guilty in Beating Death of WW2 Veteran
headline.print_headline: Teenager Pleads Guilty in Beating Death of WW2 Veteran

docs.lead_paragraph: A 17-year-old pleaded guilty Wednesday to murder in the beating death of 88-year-old Delbert Belton, a World War II veteran who survived the battle of Okinawa but was killed in a robbery outside a Washington state bar in 2013.
docs.snippet: A 17-year-old pleaded guilty Wednesday to murder in the beating death of 88-year-old Delbert Belton, a World War II veteran who survived the battle of Okinawa but was killed in a robbery outside a Washington state bar in 2013....

headline.main: Anti-terror police hunt for Paris killers in eastern French city of Reims
headline.sub: Anti-terror police hunt for Paris killers in eastern French city of Reims

docs.lead_paragraph: Heavily armed French anti-terror forces scour Reims in hunt for three men wanted in connection with attack on satirical magazine in which 12 people died. Rough Cut (no reporter narration).
docs.snippet: Heavily armed French anti-terror forces scour Reims in hunt for three men wanted in connection with attack on satirical magazine in which 12 people died. Rough Cut (no reporter narration)....

headline.main: Bank of America Shifts Compliance Team Out of Legal Unit After OCC Pressure-Source
headline.print_headline: Bank of America Shifts Compliance Team Out of Legal Unit After OCC Pressure-Source

docs.lead_paragraph: Under pressure from its U.S. regulator, Bank of America has  shifted its compliance group from its legal department to its risk oversight group, a source familiar with the matter said.
docs.snippet: Under pressure from its U.S. regulator, Bank of America has  shifted its compliance group from its legal department to its risk oversight group, a source familiar with the matter said....

headline.main: Coldest Temps Since Polar Vortex Test U.S. Transport Network
headline.print_headline: Coldest Temps Since Polar Vortex Test U.S. Transport Network

docs.lead_paragraph: Armed with lessons learned from last year's polar vortex, the U.S. transportation and shipping network faces its first big test of the winter this week as harsh cold and dangerous wind chills buffet the Plains to the East Coast.
docs.snippet: Armed with lessons learned from last year's polar vortex, the U.S. transportation and shipping network faces its first big test of the winter this week as harsh cold and dangerous wind chills buffet the Plains to the East Coast....

headline.main: China Says North Korea Deserter Who Reportedly Killed Four Dies From Injuries
headline.print_headline: China Says North Korea Deserter Who Reportedly Killed Four Dies From Injuries

docs.lead_paragraph: A North Korean army deserter who crossed the border and reportedly killed four Chinese people in a robbery last month has died from injuries suffered during his capture, the Chinese foreign ministry said late on Wednesday.
docs.snippet: A North Korean army deserter who crossed the border and reportedly killed four Chinese people in a robbery last month has died from injuries suffered during his capture, the Chinese foreign ministry said late on Wednesday....

headline.main: More women accuse Cosby of assault, Writers Guild announces nominees
headline.sub: More women accuse Cosby of assault, Writers Guild announces nominees

docs.lead_paragraph: The day's top showbiz news and headlines including more women accuse Bill Cosby of assault, the Writers Guild announces their award nominees, and Benedict Cumberbatch and Sophie Hunter are expecting a baby. Bob Mezan reports.
